author: faraggi
content:
What would happen if the POS algo is found to be somehow corrupt in the future? or simply stops working.
Can the eth2 chain be reversed to POW? or be (temporarily?) pointed to the eth1 shard ?

(any)Where can I read more about this?

author: m.kalinin
content: Bringing execution to the beacon chain is the preferable approach for merging eth1 into eth2. The merge is one of the two major upgrades of the beacon chain (alongside with sharding) and definitely not something that is planned to happen within next weeks.

author: m.kalinin
content: If beacon chain stopped working or became corrupted it would mean that eth1 shard wouldn't be secured as well. Security properties and quality of new PoS chain are going to be highly evaluated before switching off the PoW. IMO, there is no way back to PoW once it's been turned off and the beacon chain will have to be fixed if something bad happens, though, after months of evaluation it seems to be much less realistic scenario.
